p: Our procedure was effective in detecting IAS from high‐risk sites in southern Ontario. Among the 2,535 BINs identified, two regulated insect species known to be established in the area, A. planipennis (order Coleoptera) and L. dispar (order Lepidoptera), were identified and also validated by a more than 97% mean similarity over a minimum of 392 bp (Table 4). Species were identified using two independent data analysis pipelines to significantly reduce the likelihood of false positives.
